body: Looking at it more it seems that whole section for `[OpenID Connect](https://quarkus.io/guides/all-config#quarkus-oidc_quarkus-oidc-openid-connect)` missing on main preview [OpenID Connect](https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/all-config#quarkus-oidc_quarkus-oidc-openid-connect)
Looks like the individual properties which represent groups are not expanded
When I look for `quarkus.oidc`, I can see the `quarkus.oidc.credentials.*` block.
Ah OK, sorry, I misunderstood, they are in the all config doc but not in the partial include.
Ah no, I even misunderstood again, you're complaining about `main` missing things. It's probably due to the new extension annotation processor, I will have a look.

issue.title: Config Doc - Fix two scanning issues
issue.body: The second commit fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/42815 . The first one, I'm not sure it actually causes issues in the wild but we need it for correctness.

body:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/42835 will address it.

That's a very good catch, thanks a lot!

Next time, maybe don't hide the URLs behind links or mention explicitly you're testing the `main` doc as it took me some time to figure out you were talking about the doc for `main`. Thanks!

issue.title: Documentation generation for configuration properties in OIDC module leaves out plenty of information
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I go to https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/all-config or https://quarkus.io/guides/all-config and type `quarkus.oidc.credentials`. Literally no credential properties have documentation. However if I go to Java config class, I can see there is nice Javadoc:

- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/oidc-common/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/oidc/common/runtime/OidcClientCommonConfig.java#L52
- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/613cdf3670f2ef234c93805e5a8aacb5f09f20d0/extensions/oidc-common/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/oidc/common/runtime/OidcClientCommonConfig.java#L136

Try it also for `quarkus.oidc.tls` and `quarkus.oidc-client.tls` and so on. Same problem.

### Expected behavior

Users can read what are properties for.

### Actual behavior

Users don't see documentation.

### How to Reproduce?

Write `quarkus.oidc` in the all config page and find many other OIDC properties without docs.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
